alert.note: Alert for Winona (Minnesota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS LaCrosse (Southwestern Wisconsin, Southeastern Minnesota, and Northeast Iowa)
info.headline: Wind Chill Advisory issued January 05 at 3:09PM CST until January 06 at 3:00PM CST by NWS LaCrosse
info.description: ...Blowing and Drifting Snow Continues... .While most of the accumulating snow has or will end across the area, wind gusts remain strong at times causing some blowing and drifting snow. This is especially true in open areas or ridge locations where snow may be blown aloft causing temporary reduction in visibilities. Drifts may cross roads at times too. Be careful near other vehicles or trucks that might stir up fresh snow causing temporary white out conditions as well. There will be travel impacts, including the afternoon commute. Plan now and check road conditions and the latest forecast before heading out. In addition, very cold wind chills will start to filter into the area. ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 PM CST THIS EVENING... ...WIND CHILL ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 9 PM THIS EVENING TO 3 PM CST THURSDAY... * WHAT...For the Winter Weather Advisory, blowing snow. Winds gusting as high as 40 mph. For the Wind Chill Advisory, very cold wind chills expected. Wind chills as low as 30 below zero tonight. * WHERE...Portions of north central and northeast Iowa and southeast Minnesota. * WHEN...For the Winter Weather Advisory, until 6 PM CST this evening. For the Wind Chill Advisory, from 9 PM this evening to 3 PM CST Thursday. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. Blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. The hazardous conditions could impact the evening commute. Gusty winds could bring down tree branches. The cold wind chills could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 30 minutes tonight and Thursday morning.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. Use caution while traveling outside. Wear appropriate clothing, a hat, and gloves. For the latest road conditions, check 511ia.org in Iowa, or 511mn.org in Minnesota.
